channel.title: productivity on Ayrat's Braindump
channel.description: Recent content in productivity on Ayrat's Braindump

item.title: Cargo-mode
item.description: cargo-mode - Emacs minor mode which allows to dynamically select a Cargo command. Cargo is the Rust package manager.

item.title: Cool terminal apps
item.description: Task management Taskwarrior Terminal navigation Other Spotify terminal client it requires the GUI client. But still it’s cool to browse and play spotify from your terminal More stufff awesome-cli-apps - list of cool cli apps

item.title: Emacs
item.description: Emacs is an (esoteric) text editor. Its key feature is extensibility. Emacs provides Emacs Lisp programming language which is used to write extensions. Great Emacs packages: Magit - a git interface Org-Mode is a document editing, formatting, and organizing mode Org-Roam is a personal knowledge management tool You can check out my blog post I wrote a long time ago where I’m trying to sell Emacs.

item.title: Git Submodules
item.description: Deleting submodule Delete the relevant section from the .gitmodules file. Stage the .gitmodules changes git add .gitmodules Delete the relevant section from .git/config. Run git rm –cached path_to_submodule (no trailing slash). Run rm -rf .git/modules/path_to_submodule (no trailing slash). Commit git commit -m “Removed submodule " Delete the now untracked submodule files rm -rf path_to_submodule

item.title: Taskwarrior
item.description: Taskwarrior - is a command line task list manager Thoughts: It contains a subset of features from Org Mode It may be more performant than org mode

item.title: Terminal navigation
item.description: fzf - command-line fuzzy finder https://github.com/junegunn/fzf zoxide - dir navigation https://github.com/ajeetdsouza/zoxide tmux

item.title: tmux
item.description: Tmux is a terminal multiplexer. It can be used for: running multiple apps in one terminal this can be achieved without tmux if your terminal emulator supports window splitting persistent sessions, for example, to run long-running tasks on a server Another termianl multiplexer is screen . I’ve used it for users to run long running tasks on servers. But tmux has a better community support:
